page.title: 01The River Maun
page.content: The river Maun rises in Sutton where it is called the Idle.It joins Kings Mill reservoir and then,as the Maun, flows through the Mansfield area, through{Clipstone}and Edwinstowe before finally joining the river Meden near Bothamsall. In the past the Maun supplied water to a system of{flood dykes}which,by the use of sluice gates, allowed water to irrigate the farmland.The high sewage content of the water made it ideal for this purpose.These dykes are no longer in operation and those running parallel to the river in the area we surveyed are now simply lakes which the local farmer is converting into a{wildfowl}reserve.At the time we made one of our visits he was supervising the digging of a channel on the far bank of one of the dykes to form an island to encourage breeding.
